title: The Article Plural (O -> Oi).
reading_greek: Ο καφές είναι καλός. Οι καφέδες είναι ζεστοί. Ο φίλος μου είναι εδώ. Οι φίλοι μου είναι εκεί.
reading_english: The coffee is good. The coffees are hot. My friend is here. My friends are there.
audio_script: Welcome to Week 4 of your Greek lessons. Today we are focusing on the shift from the singular masculine article 'Ο' to the plural masculine article 'Οι'. ... In Greek, 'Ο' means 'The' when referring to a single masculine item, like 'Ο καφές' (The coffee). ... When we want to talk about multiple items, 'The' changes to 'Οι'. So, 'Οι καφέδες' means 'The coffees'. ... Notice how the noun changes too, but our focus today is the article: Ο becomes Οι. ... Now, listen to a short reading passage demonstrating this shift: ... Ο καφές είναι καλός. Οι καφέδες είναι ζεστοί. Ο φίλος μου είναι εδώ. Οι φίλοι μου είναι εκεί. ... Now, let's break that down. 'Ο καφές είναι καλός' means 'The coffee is good'. 'Οι καφέδες είναι ζεστοί' means 'The coffees are hot'. ... Repeat after me: 'Ο'. ... 'Οι'. ... Excellent. Continue practicing the articles 'Ο' and 'Οι'.
